metadata.Title: CVE-2017-8421 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
The function coff_set_alignment_hook in coffcode.h in Binary File Descriptor (BFD) library (aka libbfd), as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.28, has a memory leak vulnerability which can cause memory exhaustion in objdump via a crafted PE file. Additional validation in dump_relocs_in_section in objdump.c can resolve this.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-8421` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

binutils - 2.24-5ubuntu14.2+esm5
binutils-multiarch - 2.24-5ubuntu14.2+esm5
binutils-source - 2.24-5ubuntu14.2+esm5
binutils-static - 2.24-5ubuntu14.2+esm5
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: binutils package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.24-5ubuntu14.2+esm5').
